sentence.text: Reduced exposure of imatinib after coadministration with acetaminophen in mice.
Imatinib is an efficacious drug against chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) and gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST) due to selective inhibition of c-KIT and BCR-ABL kinases
It presents almost complete bioavailability, is eliminated via P450-mediated metabolism and is well tolerated
However, a few severe drug-drug interactions have been reported in cancer patients taking acetaminophen
Male ICR mice were given 100 mg/kg single dose of imatinib orally or imatinib 100 mg/kg (orally) coadministered with acetaminophen intraperitoneally (700 mg/kg)
Mice were euthanized at predetermined time points, blood samples collected, and imatinib plasma concentration measured by HPLC
Acetaminophen affected the imatinib disposition profile: AUC(0-12) and C(max) decreased 56% and 59%, respectively and a longer half-life was observed (5
The study shows a pharmacokinetic interaction between acetaminophen and imatinib which may render further human studies necessary if both drugs are administered concurrently to cancer patients
